centralQuestion: Should governments implement universal basic income?

reasons.description: UBI can reduce poverty and income volatility by giving households a stable floor of support.

sources.title: Reuters: "U.S. cities try new way to help the poor: give them money"
Associated Press: "Tacoma experiment gives low‑income mothers $500 a month"

reasons.description: It offers security in an age of automation, supporting workers' transitions and encouraging entrepreneurship.

sources.title: Financial Times: "Universal basic income is best response to automation"
Brookings Institution: "Three reasons for universal basic income"

reasons.description: A single unconditional transfer can streamline fragmented welfare systems and cut administrative costs.

sources.title: The Economist: "What the spread of universal basic‑income schemes says about America’s safety net"
OECD: "Basic income or a single tapering rule? Incentives, inclusiveness and the cost of a universal benefit"

reasons.description: Pilot studies show unconditional cash can improve mental health and overall well‑being.

sources.title: PBS NewsHour: "Employment rose among those in free‑money experiment, study shows"
The Guardian: "Benefit or burden? The cities trying out universal basic income"

objections.description: UBI would impose unsustainably high fiscal costs, requiring drastic tax increases or cuts elsewhere.

sources.title: The Wall Street Journal: "Why a Universal Basic Income Would Be a Calamity"
American Enterprise Institute: "UBI Needs AGI to Make Sense"

objections.description: Guaranteed income could disincentivize work, especially among young or lower‑skill workers.

sources.title: Bloomberg News: "Generation Z Should Fear a Guaranteed Income"
The Times: "Universal basic income is not the answer if AI comes for your job"

objections.description: Analyses suggest a flat universal transfer may fail to cut poverty if it replaces targeted programs.

sources.title: Financial Times: "Universal basic income would fail to cut poverty, says OECD"

research.title: The Labor Market Impacts of Universal and Permanent Cash Transfers: Evidence from the Alaska Permanent Fund
research.description: American Economic Journal: Economic Policy (2025) finds the annual dividend had no significant effect on total employment but raised part‑time work, indicating limited labor‑supply disincentives.

research.title: Short‑term impacts of Universal Basic Income on population mental health inequalities in the UK
research.description: PLOS Medicine (2024) microsimulation shows UBI could narrow mental‑health gaps, especially for women, if most recipients stay in work.

research.title: Effects of guaranteed basic income interventions on poverty‑related outcomes in high‑income countries: A systematic review
research.description: Campbell Systematic Reviews (2023) synthesizes 27 studies and concludes unconditional transfers generally reduce poverty depth and income volatility.

research.title: Basic Income in the Finnish Context
research.description: Intereconomics (2017) microsimulation finds a revenue‑neutral UBI simplifies benefits but needs higher taxation to achieve meaningful redistribution.
